intro: Collomia lanceolata, commonly known as the narrowleaf phlox, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Polemoniaceae family, which includes other showy flowering plants. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and prominent stamens, making it a striking addition to wildflower gardens. It blooms in late spring to early summer and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
